title: How to testing component
body:
Hi, I have component: ``` class eleventh.envelopes.react.List ###* @param {eleventh.envelopes.Storage} storage @constructor ### constructor: (storage) -> {ul, li, input} = React.DOM @create = React.createClass displayName: 'Envelope.List', render: -> ul null, @props.envelopes.map (envelope) => li style: color: envelope.color key: envelope.id envelope.name handleRemoveEnvelope: (envelope) -> @props.removeEnvelope envelope handleEditEnvelope: (envelope) -> @props.editEnvelope envelope ``` and I want write some test. For example - component has generate ```
  • text
``` My test: ``` React = require process.cwd() + '/bower_components/react/react-with-addons' ReactTestUtils = React.addons.TestUtils {renderIntoDocument, isCompositeComponent} = ReactTestUtils {expect} = require 'chai' List = eleventh.envelopes.react.List suite 'eleventh.envelopes.react.List', -> list = {} setup -> list = new List list = list.create envelopes: {} suite 'List', -> test 'should be a React component', -> expect(isCompositeComponent list).to.be.true test 'should be a generate ul list', -> component = renderIntoDocument list.isMounted() ``` and result: ``` ․Warning: Only React Components are valid for mounting. ․ 1 passing (2ms) 1 failing 1) eleventh.envelopes.react.List List should be a generate ul list: TypeError: Object false has no method 'mountComponentIntoNode' ``` I can not figure out how to test component. Still some errors. I could not find any good article about it. Thanks
